lines.text:
[playing checkers]
You're really fun! You certainly aren't dull like all those princes.
Maybe that's because I'm not a prince.
Do you think I'm pretty?
Do I think you're pretty? I think you're very pretty.
Would you pick me to marry?
I might. Except I'm a little bit older than you and I think that maybe you should be with some young, handsome man, someone who can keep up with you.
I should?
Definitely.
[places checker piece down]
King me.

Bills, bills, bills, nothing but bills! Two thousand francs for oranges? They might as well squeeze me dry! A thousand five hundred francs for muskets? Why, there hasn't been a shot fired in this kingdom for years! They can see a king coming a mile away!
You know, most women your age are already married.
I take that as a compliment, soldier. My father has been trying to marry me off for years, but I am not marrying kind.
Oh really? I would have thought otherwise.
No. I have no patience for hearts and flowers and young men who brag about this victory and that. There's more to life than romance.
Eh, this cloak is a dud... God king Wenceslas, where's my arm? My arm is gone!
Oh, hello.
Hello.
And to what do I owe the honour of this visit, hmmm?
Well my sisters and I thought you might like some cookies and milk before retiring.
Cookies and Milk? Oh, my favorite. Is that your father over there?
[pours milk out in plant while Jeanetta turns her head]
